question.title: Spring does not recognize @PreAuthorize inside custom annotation
question.body:
If I use the just standard way @PreAuthorize("hasRole(@roleProperties.getSelect()) or hasRole(@roleProperties.getOtherSelect())") over my RestController methods, the @PreAuthorize works perfectly fine as it should. But since I have very many methods for which I'd like to use this same @PreAuthorize line, I thought that I should just make my own simple annotation @RequireRoleSelect like this:

    @Target({ElementType.METHOD, ElementType.TYPE})
    @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole(@roleProperties.getSelect()) or hasRole(@roleProperties.getOtherSelect())")
    public @interface RequireRoleSelect {}

So I don't have to write that long @PreAuthroize line in my controller methods and if I ever needs to add something else to that I could easily just modify my own annotation instead of editing all the @PreAuthroize lines. It makes the code just more readable.

The problem is that if I do this I'm getting this warning: Forbidden: Access denied. One of the following annotations is required on controller methods: @Secured, @PreAuthorize, @PostAuthorize, @RolesAllowed. Which in my eyes seems that Spring does not see the @PreAuthroize inside my own @RequireRoleSelect annotation.

So my question is how to make this work? If it gets super complicated then maybe there are other ways to battle this "copy paste problem"? I will welcome any reasonable solution.

question_comments.body: Just as an FYI: You can define PreAuthorize on class level too, that should already save a lot of duplication and no need for creating a framework on top of a framework. And it is possible to define the roles as a static String too to further reduce duplication.
